title: How to Add New Words to Your iPhone Dictionary: 4 Ways

steps.title: Open the Pages app.
steps.content: Open the Pages app. Pages is Apple's built-in word processing app for the iPhone. If you deleted the Pages app, reinstall it from the App Store for free.

steps.title: Type your word in a new document.
steps.content: Type your word in a new document. You can type as many words as you like.

steps.title: Double-tap the word, which should be underlined in red.
steps.content: Double-tap the word, which should be underlined in red. A contextual menu will appear.

steps.title: Scroll over and tap Learn Spelling.
steps.content: Scroll over and tap Learn Spelling . The word will be added to your iPhone dictionary, and your iPhone won't correct that spelling anymore. Repeat steps 3 and 4 for each word you want to add.

steps.title: Tap the gear icon on your iPhone’s home screen.
steps.content: Tap the gear icon on your iPhone’s home screen. The Settings menu of your device will open up.

steps.title: Tap the General option.
steps.content: Tap the General option. This will open up the General Settings menu.

steps.title: Go to Keyboard.
steps.content: Go to Keyboard . In the General Settings menu, scroll down a bit and tap Keyboard to open the Keyboard Settings menu. When you enter the Keyboard Settings menu, check that these are enabled: Auto Correction, Check Spelling, and "." Shortcut.

steps.title: Tap on Text Replacement.
steps.content: Tap on Text Replacement . If you're on an older version of iOS, it may say Add Shortcut instead.

steps.title: Tap the + button.
steps.content: Tap the + button. It's in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Type in the word you want to add in the "Phrase" box.
steps.content: Type in the word you want to add in the "Phrase" box. You can leave the "shortcut" box empty.

steps.title: Tap on Save when you're done.
steps.content: Tap on Save when you're done. You can see and use your inputted word without autocorrect interfering.

steps.title: Open the Contacts app.
steps.content: Open the Contacts app. You can either open the Contacts app directly, or tap on the Phone app and go to the Contacts tab.

steps.title: Tap the + button.
steps.content: Tap the + button. It's in the upper-right corner.

steps.title: Add a new contact with your word(s) as the first name.
steps.content: Add a new contact with your word(s) as the first name. You can add multiple words to this contact, separated by a space. Your iPhone will then recognize these words and not try to autocorrect them when you type them. Your iPhone will now recognize the words you added to the contact and not try to autocorrect them when you type them.

steps.title: Tap Done in the upper right corner.
steps.content: Tap Done in the upper right corner.

steps.title: Correct autocorrect when it tries to change your words.
steps.content: Correct autocorrect when it tries to change your words. When you type a word autocorrect doesn't know, it will appear above your texts in the suggested words with quotes around it. Tap that option. Repeat this until your iPhone learns that you're not misspelling a word, but typing it like that on purpose.
